net.canarymod.backbone

Class BackbonePermissions

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.canarymod.backbone.Backbone
      • net.canarymod.backbone.BackbonePermissions

  • public class BackbonePermissions
extends Backbone
    Backbone to the permissions System. This contains NO logic, it is only the data source access!
    Author:
    Chris (damagefilter)

      • loadGroupPermissions

        public PermissionProvider loadGroupPermissions(java.lang.String name,
                                               java.lang.String world)
        Load permissions for a group
        Parameters:
        name - the group name
        world - the world name
        Returns:
        PermissionsProvider instance for this group.

      • loadPlayerPermissions

        public PermissionProvider loadPlayerPermissions(java.lang.String uuid,
                                                java.lang.String world)
        Load permissions for a player
        Parameters:
        uuid - uuid of the player.
        world - the world name
        Returns:
        PermissionProvider for this player.

      • saveGroupPermissions

        public void saveGroupPermissions(Group g)
        Saves group permissions. This also adds new permissions + relations if there are any and and updates existing ones
        Parameters:
        g - Group to save permission from to the database.

      • saveUserPermissions

        public void saveUserPermissions(Player p)
        Save user permissions to file and add new ones if needed + update relations
        Parameters:
        p - Player to save permissions for to the database.

      • removePermission

        public void removePermission(java.lang.String path,
                             java.lang.String world)
        Remove a permission from database. This also removes any relations to groups and players
        Parameters:
        path - String representation of the permission to remove.
        EXAMPLE: "canary.command.player.compass"
        world - The fully qualified world name as given by World.getFqName()
        Can be null to access the global permissions table.

      • removePermission

        public void removePermission(java.lang.String path,
                             java.lang.String subject,
                             java.lang.String world,
                             boolean isPlayer)
        Removes a permission specific to a player or group
        Parameters:
        path - the permission node
        subject - the name of the subject (either group or player uuid)
        world - The fully qualified world name as given by World.getFqName()
        Can be null to access the global permissions table.
        isPlayer - true if player; false if not

      • removePermissions

        public void removePermissions(Group group)
        Remove all permissions that belong to the given group!
        Parameters:
        group -

      • addPermission

        public int addPermission(java.lang.String path,
                         boolean value,
                         java.lang.String owner,
                         java.lang.String type,
                         java.lang.String world)
        Add a new Permission to database and return its proper object. If the permission already exists, it will be updated instead and the appropriate ID will be returned.
        Parameters:
        path - String representation of the permission to add.
        EXAMPLE: "canary.command.player.compass"
        value - Whether permission is true or false.
        owner - Name of the owner. Can be a player UUID or a group name.
        type - "player" or "group".
        world - The fully qualified world name as given by World.getFqName()
        Can be null to access the global permissions table.
        Returns:
        The ID for the permission.

      • updatePermission

        public int updatePermission(java.lang.String path,
                            java.lang.String owner,
                            java.lang.String type,
                            java.lang.String world,
                            boolean value)
        Update a permission node with the given values. The values given must clearly identify the node to update.
        Parameters:
        path - String representation of the permission to add.
        EXAMPLE: "canary.command.player.compass"
        owner - Name of the owner. Can be a player UUID or a group name.
        type - "player" or "group".
        world - The fully qualified world name as given by World.getFqName()
        Can be null to access the global permissions table.
        value - True or false
        Returns:
        The ID of the updated permission

      • pathExists

        public boolean pathExists(java.lang.String path,
                          java.lang.String owner,
                          java.lang.String type,
                          java.lang.String world)

      • createDefaultPermissionSet

        public static void createDefaultPermissionSet()
        Creates a range of default permissions for the default groups defined in BackboneGroups

      • validatePlayerPermissions

        public void validatePlayerPermissions(java.lang.String world)
        Validate that player permissions have a UUID and not a playername.
